elements.text: The organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy are established, communicated, and monitored
elements.title: GOVERN

elements.text: The circumstances - mission, stakeholder expectations, dependencies, and legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements - surrounding the organization's cybersecurity risk management decisions are understood
elements.title: Organizational Context

elements.text: The organizational mission is understood and informs cybersecurity risk management
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Share the organization's mission (e.g., through vision and mission statements, marketing, and service strategies) to provide a basis for identifying risks that may impede that mission
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Internal and external stakeholders are understood, and their needs and expectations regarding cybersecurity risk management are understood and considered
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Identify relevant internal stakeholders and their cybersecurity-related expectations (e.g., performance and risk expectations of officers, directors, and advisors; cultural expectations of employees)
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Identify relevant external stakeholders and their cybersecurity-related expectations (e.g., privacy expectations of customers, business expectations of partnerships, compliance expectations of regulators, ethics expectations of society)
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements regarding cybersecurity - including privacy and civil liberties obligations - are understood and managed
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Determine a process to track and manage legal and regulatory requirements regarding protection of individuals' information (e.g., Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act, California Consumer Privacy Act, General Data Protection Regulation)
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Determine a process to track and manage contractual requirements for cybersecurity management of supplier, customer, and partner information
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Align the organization's cybersecurity strategy with legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Critical objectives, capabilities, and services that external stakeholders depend on or expect from the organization are understood and communicated
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Establish criteria for determining the criticality of capabilities and services as viewed by internal and external stakeholders
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Determine (e.g., from a business impact analysis) assets and business operations that are vital to achieving mission objectives and the potential impact of a loss (or partial loss) of such operations
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Establish and communicate resilience objectives (e.g., recovery time objectives) for delivering critical capabilities and services in various operating states (e.g., under attack, during recovery, normal operation)
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Outcomes, capabilities, and services that the organization depends on are understood and communicated
Create an inventory of the organization's dependencies on external resources (e.g., facilities, cloud-based hosting providers) and their relationships to organizational assets and business functions
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Identify and document external dependencies that are potential points of failure for the organization's critical capabilities and services, and share that information with appropriate personnel
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: The organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerance and appetite statements, and assumptions are established, communicated, and used to support operational risk decisions
elements.title: Risk Management Strategy

elements.text: Risk management objectives are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Update near-term and long-term cybersecurity risk management objectives as part of annual strategic planning and when major changes occur
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Establish measurable objectives for cybersecurity risk management (e.g., manage the quality of user training, ensure adequate risk protection for industrial control systems)
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Senior leaders agree about cybersecurity objectives and use them for measuring and managing risk and performance
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Risk appetite and risk tolerance statements are established, communicated, and maintained
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Determine and communicate risk appetite statements that convey expectations about the appropriate level of risk for the organization
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Translate risk appetite statements into specific, measurable, and broadly understandable risk tolerance statements
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Refine organizational objectives and risk appetite periodically based on known risk exposure and residual risk
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Cybersecurity risk management activities and outcomes are included in enterprise risk management processes
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Aggregate and manage cybersecurity risks alongside other enterprise risks (e.g., compliance, financial, operational, regulatory, reputational, safety)
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Include cybersecurity risk managers in enterprise risk management planning
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Establish criteria for escalating cybersecurity risks within enterprise risk management
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Strategic direction that describes appropriate risk response options is established and communicated
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Specify criteria for accepting and avoiding cybersecurity risk for various classifications of data
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Determine whether to purchase cybersecurity insurance
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Document conditions under which shared responsibility models are acceptable (e.g., outsourcing certain cybersecurity functions, having a third party perform financial transactions on behalf of the organization, using public cloud-based services)
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Lines of communication across the organization are established for cybersecurity risks, including risks from suppliers and other third parties
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Determine how to update senior executives, directors, and management on the organization's cybersecurity posture at agreed-upon intervals
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Identify how all departments across the organization - such as management, operations, internal auditors, legal, acquisition, physical security, and HR - will communicate with each other about cybersecurity risks
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: A standardized method for calculating, documenting, categorizing, and prioritizing cybersecurity risks is established and communicated
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Establish criteria for using a quantitative approach to cybersecurity risk analysis, and specify probability and exposure formulas
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Create and use templates (e.g., a risk register) to document cybersecurity risk information (e.g., risk description, exposure, treatment, and ownership)
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Establish criteria for risk prioritization at the appropriate levels within the enterprise
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Use a consistent list of risk categories to support integrating, aggregating, and comparing cybersecurity risks
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Strategic opportunities (i.e., positive risks) are characterized and are included in organizational cybersecurity risk discussions
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Define and communicate guidance and methods for identifying opportunities and including them in risk discussions (e.g., strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats [SWOT] analysis)
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Identify stretch goals and document them
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Calculate, document, and prioritize positive risks alongside negative risks
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and authorities to foster accountability, performance assessment, and continuous improvement are established and communicated
elements.title: Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities

elements.text: Organizational leadership is responsible and accountable for cybersecurity risk and fosters a culture that is risk-aware, ethical, and continually improving
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Leaders (e.g., directors) agree on their roles and responsibilities in developing, implementing, and assessing the organization's cybersecurity strategy
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Share leaders' expectations regarding a secure and ethical culture, especially when current events present the opportunity to highlight positive or negative examples of cybersecurity risk management
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Leaders direct the CISO to maintain a comprehensive cybersecurity risk strategy and review and update it at least annually and after major events
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Conduct reviews to ensure adequate authority and coordination among those responsible for managing cybersecurity risk
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Roles, responsibilities, and authorities related to cybersecurity risk management are established, communicated, understood, and enforced
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Document risk management roles and responsibilities in policy
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Document who is responsible and accountable for cybersecurity risk management activities and how those teams and individuals are to be consulted and informed
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Include cybersecurity responsibilities and performance requirements in personnel descriptions
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Document performance goals for personnel with cybersecurity risk management responsibilities, and periodically measure performance to identify areas for improvement
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Clearly articulate cybersecurity responsibilities within operations, risk functions, and internal audit functions
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: Adequate resources are allocated commensurate with the cybersecurity risk strategy, roles, responsibilities, and policies
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Conduct periodic management reviews to ensure that those given cybersecurity risk management responsibilities have the necessary authority
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Identify resource allocation and investment in line with risk tolerance and response
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Provide adequate and sufficient people, process, and technical resources to support the cybersecurity strategy
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Integrate cybersecurity risk management considerations into human resources processes (e.g., personnel screening, onboarding, change notification, offboarding)
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Consider cybersecurity knowledge to be a positive factor in hiring, training, and retention decisions
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Conduct background checks prior to onboarding new personnel for sensitive roles, and periodically repeat background checks for personnel with such roles
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Define and enforce obligations for personnel to be aware of, adhere to, and uphold security policies as they relate to their roles
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Organizational cybersecurity policy is established, communicated, and enforced
elements.title: Policy

elements.text: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is established based on organizational context, cybersecurity strategy, and priorities and is communicated and enforced
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Create, disseminate, and maintain an understandable, usable risk management policy with statements of management intent, expectations, and direction
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Periodically review policy and supporting processes and procedures to ensure that they align with risk management strategy objectives and priorities, as well as the high-level direction of the cybersecurity policy
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Require approval from senior management on policy
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Communicate cybersecurity risk management policy and supporting processes and procedures across the organization
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Require personnel to acknowledge receipt of policy when first hired, annually, and whenever policy is updated
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is reviewed, updated, communicated, and enforced to reflect changes in requirements, threats, technology, and organizational mission
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Update policy based on periodic reviews of cybersecurity risk management results to ensure that policy and supporting processes and procedures adequately maintain risk at an acceptable level
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Provide a timeline for reviewing changes to the organization's risk environment (e.g., changes in risk or in the organization's mission objectives), and communicate recommended policy updates
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Update policy to reflect changes in legal and regulatory requirements
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Update policy to reflect changes in technology (e.g., adoption of artificial intelligence) and changes to the business (e.g., acquisition of a new business, new contract requirements)
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Results of organization-wide cybersecurity risk management activities and performance are used to inform, improve, and adjust the risk management strategy
elements.title: Oversight

elements.text: Cybersecurity risk management strategy outcomes are reviewed to inform and adjust strategy and direction
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Measure how well the risk management strategy and risk results have helped leaders make decisions and achieve organizational objectives
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Examine whether cybersecurity risk strategies that impede operations or innovation should be adjusted
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: The cybersecurity risk management strategy is reviewed and adjusted to ensure coverage of organizational requirements and risks
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Review audit findings to confirm whether the existing cybersecurity strategy has ensured compliance with internal and external requirements
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Review the performance oversight of those in cybersecurity-related roles to determine whether policy changes are necessary
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Review strategy in light of cybersecurity incidents
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Organizational cybersecurity risk management performance is evaluated and reviewed for adjustments needed
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Review key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure that organization-wide policies and procedures achieve objectives
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Review key risk indicators (KRIs) to identify risks the organization faces, including likelihood and potential impact
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Collect and communicate metrics on cybersecurity risk management with senior leadership
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, managed, monitored, and improved by organizational stakeholders
elements.title: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management

elements.text: A cybersecurity supply chain risk management program, strategy, objectives, policies, and processes are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders
Establish a strategy that expresses the objectives of the cybersecurity supply chain risk management program
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Develop the cybersecurity supply chain risk management program, including a plan (with milestones), policies, and procedures that guide implementation and improvement of the program, and share the policies and procedures with the organizational stakeholders
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Develop and implement program processes based on the strategy, objectives, policies, and procedures that are agreed upon and performed by the organizational stakeholders
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Establish a cross-organizational mechanism that ensures alignment between functions that contribute to cybersecurity supply chain risk management, such as cybersecurity, IT, operations, legal, human resources, and engineering
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for suppliers, customers, and partners are established, communicated, and coordinated internally and externally
Identify one or more specific roles or positions that will be responsible and accountable for planning, resourcing, and executing cybersecurity supply chain risk management activities
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Document cybersecurity supply chain risk management roles and responsibilities in policy
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Create responsibility matrixes to document who will be responsible and accountable for cybersecurity supply chain risk management activities and how those teams and individuals will be consulted and informed
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Include cybersecurity supply chain risk management responsibilities and performance requirements in personnel descriptions to ensure clarity and improve accountability
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Document performance goals for personnel with cybersecurity risk management-specific responsibilities, and periodically measure them to demonstrate and improve performance
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: Develop roles and responsibilities for suppliers, customers, and business partners to address shared responsibilities for applicable cybersecurity risks, and integrate them into organizational policies and applicable third-party agreements
elements.title: Ex6

elements.text: Internally communicate cybersecurity supply chain risk management roles and responsibilities for third parties
elements.title: Ex7

elements.text: Establish rules and protocols for information sharing and reporting processes between the organization and its suppliers
elements.title: Ex8

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management is integrated into cybersecurity and enterprise risk management, risk assessment, and improvement processes
Identify areas of alignment and overlap with cybersecurity and enterprise risk management
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Establish integrated control sets for cybersecurity risk management and cybersecurity supply chain risk management
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Integrate cybersecurity supply chain risk management into improvement processes
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Escalate material cybersecurity risks in supply chains to senior management, and address them at the enterprise risk management level
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Suppliers are known and prioritized by criticality

Develop criteria for supplier criticality based on, for example, the sensitivity of data processed or possessed by suppliers, the degree of access to the organization's systems, and the importance of the products or services to the organization's mission
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Keep a record of all suppliers, and prioritize suppliers based on the criticality criteria
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Requirements to address cybersecurity risks in supply chains are established, prioritized, and integrated into contracts and other types of agreements with suppliers and other relevant third parties
Establish security requirements for suppliers, products, and services commensurate with their criticality level and potential impact if compromised
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Include all cybersecurity and supply chain requirements that third parties must follow and how compliance with the requirements may be verified in default contractual language
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Define the rules and protocols for information sharing between the organization and its suppliers and sub-tier suppliers in agreements
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Manage risk by including security requirements in agreements based on their criticality and potential impact if compromised
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Define security requirements in service-level agreements (SLAs) for monitoring suppliers for acceptable security performance throughout the supplier relationship lifecycle
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: Contractually require suppliers to disclose cybersecurity features, functions, and vulnerabilities of their products and services for the life of the product or the term of service
elements.title: Ex6

elements.text: Contractually require suppliers to provide and maintain a current component inventory (e.g., software or hardware bill of materials) for critical products
elements.title: Ex7

elements.text: Contractually require suppliers to vet their employees and guard against insider threats
elements.title: Ex8

elements.text: Contractually require suppliers to provide evidence of performing acceptable security practices through, for example, self-attestation, conformance to known standards, certifications, or inspections
elements.title: Ex9

elements.text: Specify in contracts and other agreements the rights and responsibilities of the organization, its suppliers, and their supply chains, with respect to potential cybersecurity risks
elements.title: Ex10

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Planning and due diligence are performed to reduce risks before entering into formal supplier or other third-party relationships
Perform thorough due diligence on prospective suppliers that is consistent with procurement planning and commensurate with the level of risk, criticality, and complexity of each supplier relationship
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Assess the suitability of the technology and cybersecurity capabilities and the risk management practices of prospective suppliers
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Conduct supplier risk assessments against business and applicable cybersecurity requirements
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Assess the authenticity, integrity, and security of critical products prior to acquisition and use
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: The risks posed by a supplier, their products and services, and other third parties are understood, recorded, prioritized, assessed, responded to, and monitored over the course of the relationship
Adjust assessment formats and frequencies based on the third party's reputation and the criticality of the products or services they provide
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Evaluate third parties' evidence of compliance with contractual cybersecurity requirements, such as self-attestations, warranties, certifications, and other artifacts
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Monitor critical suppliers to ensure that they are fulfilling their security obligations throughout the supplier relationship lifecycle using a variety of methods and techniques, such as inspections, audits, tests, or other forms of evaluation
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Monitor critical suppliers, services, and products for changes to their risk profiles, and reevaluate supplier criticality and risk impact accordingly
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Plan for unexpected supplier and supply chain-related interruptions to ensure business continuity
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Relevant suppliers and other third parties are included in incident planning, response, and recovery activities
Define and use rules and protocols for reporting incident response and recovery activities and the status between the organization and its suppliers
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Identify and document the roles and responsibilities of the organization and its suppliers for incident response
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Include critical suppliers in incident response exercises and simulations
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Define and coordinate crisis communication methods and protocols between the organization and its critical suppliers
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Conduct collaborative lessons learned sessions with critical suppliers
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Supply chain security practices are integrated into cybersecurity and enterprise risk management programs, and their performance is monitored throughout the technology product and service life cycle
Policies and procedures require provenance records for all acquired technology products and services
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Periodically provide risk reporting to leaders about how acquired components are proven to be untampered and authentic
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Communicate regularly among cybersecurity risk managers and operations personnel about the need to acquire software patches, updates, and upgrades only from authenticated and trustworthy software providers
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Review policies to ensure that they require approved supplier personnel to perform maintenance on supplier products
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Policies and procedure require checking upgrades to critical hardware for unauthorized changes
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management plans include provisions for activities that occur after the conclusion of a partnership or service agreement
Establish processes for terminating critical relationships under both normal and adverse circumstances
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Define and implement plans for component end-of-life maintenance support and obsolescence
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Verify that supplier access to organization resources is deactivated promptly when it is no longer needed
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Verify that assets containing the organization's data are returned or properly disposed of in a timely, controlled, and safe manner
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Develop and execute a plan for terminating or transitioning supplier relationships that takes supply chain security risk and resiliency into account
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: Mitigate risks to data and systems created by supplier termination
elements.title: Ex6

elements.text: Manage data leakage risks associated with supplier termination
elements.title: Ex7

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: The organization's current cybersecurity risks are understood
elements.title: IDENTIFY

elements.text: Assets (e.g., data, hardware, software, systems, facilities, services, people) that enable the organization to achieve business purposes are identified and managed consistent with their relative importance to organizational objectives and the organization's risk strategy
elements.title: Asset Management

elements.text: Inventories of hardware managed by the organization are maintained
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Maintain inventories for all types of hardware, including IT, IoT, OT, and mobile devices
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Constantly monitor networks to detect new hardware and automatically update inventories
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Inventories of software, services, and systems managed by the organization are maintained
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Maintain inventories for all types of software and services, including commercial-off-the-shelf, open-source, custom applications, API services, and cloud-based applications and services
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Constantly monitor all platforms, including containers and virtual machines, for software and service inventory changes
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Maintain an inventory of the organization's systems
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Representations of the organization's authorized network communication and internal and external network data flows are maintained
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Maintain baselines of communication and data flows within the organization's wired and wireless networks
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Maintain baselines of communication and data flows between the organization and third parties
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Maintain baselines of communication and data flows for the organization's infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS) usage
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Maintain documentation of expected network ports, protocols, and services that are typically used among authorized systems
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Inventories of services provided by suppliers are maintained

Inventory all external services used by the organization, including third-party infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS), platform-as-a-service (PaaS), and software-as-a-service (SaaS) offerings; APIs; and other externally hosted application services
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Update the inventory when a new external service is going to be utilized to ensure adequate cybersecurity risk management monitoring of the organization's use of that service
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Assets are prioritized based on classification, criticality, resources, and impact on the mission
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Define criteria for prioritizing each class of assets
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Apply the prioritization criteria to assets
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Track the asset priorities and update them periodically or when significant changes to the organization occur
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for the entire workforce and third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) are established
Incorporated into GV.RR-02, GV.SC-02
Inventories of data and corresponding metadata for designated data types are maintained
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Maintain a list of the designated data types of interest (e.g., personally identifiable information, protected health information, financial account numbers, organization intellectual property, operational technology data)
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Continuously discover and analyze ad hoc data to identify new instances of designated data types
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Assign data classifications to designated data types through tags or labels
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Track the provenance, data owner, and geolocation of each instance of designated data types
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Systems, hardware, software, services, and data are managed throughout their life cycles
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Integrate cybersecurity considerations throughout the life cycles of systems, hardware, software, and services
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Integrate cybersecurity considerations into product life cycles
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Identify unofficial uses of technology to meet mission objectives (i.e., shadow IT)
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Periodically identify redundant systems, hardware, software, and services that unnecessarily increase the organization's attack surface
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Properly configure and secure systems, hardware, software, and services prior to their deployment in production
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: Update inventories when systems, hardware, software, and services are moved or transferred within the organization
elements.title: Ex6

elements.text: Securely destroy stored data based on the organization's data retention policy using the prescribed destruction method, and keep and manage a record of the destructions
elements.title: Ex7

elements.text: Securely sanitize data storage when hardware is being retired, decommissioned, reassigned, or sent for repairs or replacement
elements.title: Ex8

elements.text: Offer methods for destroying paper, storage media, and other physical forms of data storage
elements.title: Ex9

elements.text: The cybersecurity risk to the organization, assets, and individuals is understood by the organization
elements.title: Risk Assessment

elements.text: Vulnerabilities in assets are identified, validated, and recorded
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Use vulnerability management technologies to identify unpatched and misconfigured software
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Assess network and system architectures for design and implementation weaknesses that affect cybersecurity
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Review, analyze, or test organization-developed software to identify design, coding, and default configuration vulnerabilities
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Assess facilities that house critical computing assets for physical vulnerabilities and resilience issues
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Monitor sources of cyber threat intelligence for information on new vulnerabilities in products and services
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: Review processes and procedures for weaknesses that could be exploited to affect cybersecurity
elements.title: Ex6

elements.text: Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Configure cybersecurity tools and technologies with detection or response capabilities to securely ingest cyber threat intelligence feeds
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Receive and review advisories from reputable third parties on current threat actors and their tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs)
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Monitor sources of cyber threat intelligence for information on the types of vulnerabilities that emerging technologies may have
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Internal and external threats to the organization are identified and recorded
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Use cyber threat intelligence to maintain awareness of the types of threat actors likely to target the organization and the TTPs they are likely to use
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Perform threat hunting to look for signs of threat actors within the environment
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Implement processes for identifying internal threat actors
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Potential impacts and likelihoods of threats exploiting vulnerabilities are identified and recorded
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Business leaders and cybersecurity risk management practitioners work together to estimate the likelihood and impact of risk scenarios and record them in risk registers
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Enumerate the potential business impacts of unauthorized access to the organization's communications, systems, and data processed in or by those systems
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Account for the potential impacts of cascading failures for systems of systems
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to understand inherent risk and inform risk response prioritization
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Develop threat models to better understand risks to the data and identify appropriate risk responses
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Prioritize cybersecurity resource allocations and investments based on estimated likelihoods and impacts
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Risk responses are chosen, prioritized, planned, tracked, and communicated
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Apply the vulnerability management plan's criteria for deciding whether to accept, transfer, mitigate, or avoid risk
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Apply the vulnerability management plan's criteria for selecting compensating controls to mitigate risk
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Track the progress of risk response implementation (e.g., plan of action and milestones [POA&M], risk register, risk detail report)
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Use risk assessment findings to inform risk response decisions and actions
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Communicate planned risk responses to affected stakeholders in priority order
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: Changes and exceptions are managed, assessed for risk impact, recorded, and tracked
Implement and follow procedures for the formal documentation, review, testing, and approval of proposed changes and requested exceptions
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Document the possible risks of making or not making each proposed change, and provide guidance on rolling back changes
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Document the risks related to each requested exception and the plan for responding to those risks
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Periodically review risks that were accepted based upon planned future actions or milestones
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Processes for receiving, analyzing, and responding to vulnerability disclosures are established
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Conduct vulnerability information sharing between the organization and its suppliers following the rules and protocols defined in contracts
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Assign responsibilities and verify the execution of procedures for processing, analyzing the impact of, and responding to cybersecurity threat, vulnerability, or incident disclosures by suppliers, customers, partners, and government cybersecurity organizations
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: The authenticity and integrity of hardware and software are assessed prior to acquisition and use
Assess the authenticity and cybersecurity of critical technology products and services prior to acquisition and use
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Critical suppliers are assessed prior to acquisition
Conduct supplier risk assessments against business and applicable cybersecurity requirements, including the supply chain
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Improvements to organizational cybersecurity risk management processes, procedures and activities are identified across all CSF Functions
elements.title: Improvement

elements.text: Improvements are identified from evaluations
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Perform self-assessments of critical services that take current threats and TTPs into consideration
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Invest in third-party assessments or independent audits of the effectiveness of the organization's cybersecurity program to identify areas that need improvement
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Constantly evaluate compliance with selected cybersecurity requirements through automated means
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Improvements are identified from security tests and exercises, including those done in coordination with suppliers and relevant third parties
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Identify improvements for future incident response activities based on findings from incident response assessments (e.g., tabletop exercises and simulations, tests, internal reviews, independent audits)
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Identify improvements for future business continuity, disaster recovery, and incident response activities based on exercises performed in coordination with critical service providers and product suppliers
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Involve internal stakeholders (e.g., senior executives, legal department, HR) in security tests and exercises as appropriate
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Perform penetration testing to identify opportunities to improve the security posture of selected high-risk systems as approved by leadership
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Exercise contingency plans for responding to and recovering from the discovery that products or services did not originate with the contracted supplier or partner or were altered before receipt
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: Collect and analyze performance metrics using security tools and services to inform improvements to the cybersecurity program
elements.title: Ex6

elements.text: Improvements are identified from execution of operational processes, procedures, and activities
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Conduct collaborative lessons learned sessions with suppliers
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Annually review cybersecurity policies, processes, and procedures to take lessons learned into account
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Use metrics to assess operational cybersecurity performance over time
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Incident response plans and other cybersecurity plans that affect operations are established, communicated, maintained, and improved
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Establish contingency plans (e.g., incident response, business continuity, disaster recovery) for responding to and recovering from adverse events that can interfere with operations, expose confidential information, or otherwise endanger the organization's mission and viability
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Include contact and communication information, processes for handling common scenarios, and criteria for prioritization, escalation, and elevation in all contingency plans
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Create a vulnerability management plan to identify and assess all types of vulnerabilities and to prioritize, test, and implement risk responses
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Communicate cybersecurity plans (including updates) to those responsible for carrying them out and to affected parties
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Review and update all cybersecurity plans annually or when a need for significant improvements is identified
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: The organizationâ€™s role in the supply chain is identified and communicated
Incorporated into GV.OC-05
The organizationâ€™s place in critical infrastructure and its industry sector is identified and communicated
Incorporated into GV.OC-01
Priorities for organizational mission, objectives, and activities are established and communicated
Incorporated into GV.OC-01
Dependencies and critical functions for delivery of critical services are established
Incorporated into GV.OC-04, GV.OC-05
Resilience requirements to support delivery of critical services are established for all operating states (e.g. under duress/attack, during recovery, normal operations)
Incorporated into GV.OC-04
Incorporated into GV.OC
Organizational cybersecurity policy is established and communicated
Incorporated into GV.PO, GV.PO-01, GV.PO-02
Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are coordinated and aligned with internal roles and external partners
Incorporated into GV.OC-02, GV.RR, GV.RR-02
Legal and regulatory requirements regarding cybersecurity, including privacy and civil liberties obligations, are understood and managed
Moved to GV.OC-03
Governance and risk management processes address cybersecurity risks
Moved to GV.RM-04
Incorporated into GV
Risk management processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders
Incorporated into GV.RM-01, GV.RM-06, GV.RR-03
Organizational risk tolerance is determined and clearly expressed
Incorporated into GV.RM-02, GV.RM-04
The organizationâ€™s determination of risk tolerance is informed by its role in critical infrastructure and sector specific risk analysis
Moved into GV.RM-02
Incorporated into GV.RM
Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, assessed, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders
Incorporated into GV.RM-05, GV.SC-01, GV.SC-06, GV.SC-09, GV.SC-10
Suppliers and third party partners of information systems, components, and services are identified, prioritized, and assessed using a cyber supply chain risk assessment process
Incorporated into GV.OC-02, GV.SC-03, GV.SC-04, GV.SC-07, ID.RA-10

Contracts with suppliers and third-party partners are used to implement appropriate measures designed to meet the objectives of an organizationâ€™s cybersecurity program and Cyber Supply Chain Risk Management Plan.
Moved to GV.SC-05
Suppliers and third-party partners are routinely assessed using audits, test results, or other forms of evaluations to confirm they are meeting their contractual obligations.
Incorporated into GV.SC-07, ID.RA-10
Response and recovery planning and testing are conducted with suppliers and third-party providers
Incorporated into GV.SC-08, ID.IM-02
Incorporated into GV.SC
Safeguards to manage the organization's cybersecurity risks are used
elements.title: PROTECT

elements.text: Access to physical and logical assets is limited to authorized users, services, and hardware and  managed commensurate with the assessed risk of unauthorized access
elements.title: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control

elements.text: Identities and credentials for authorized users, services, and hardware are managed by the organization
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Initiate requests for new access or additional access for employees, contractors, and others, and track, review, and fulfill the requests, with permission from system or data owners when needed
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Issue, manage, and revoke cryptographic certificates and identity tokens, cryptographic keys (i.e., key management), and other credentials
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Select a unique identifier for each device from immutable hardware characteristics or an identifier securely provisioned to the device
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Physically label authorized hardware with an identifier for inventory and servicing purposes
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials based on the context of interactions
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Verify a person's claimed identity at enrollment time using government-issued identity credentials (e.g., passport, visa, driver's license)
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Issue a different credential for each person (i.e., no credential sharing)
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Users, services, and hardware are authenticated
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Require multifactor authentication
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Enforce policies for the minimum strength of passwords, PINs, and similar authenticators
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Periodically reauthenticate users, services, and hardware based on risk (e.g., in zero trust architectures)
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Ensure that authorized personnel can access accounts essential for protecting safety under emergency conditions
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Identity assertions are protected, conveyed, and verified
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Protect identity assertions that are used to convey authentication and user information through single sign-on systems
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Protect identity assertions that are used to convey authentication and user information between federated systems
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Implement standards-based approaches for identity assertions in all contexts, and follow all guidance for the generation (e.g., data models, metadata), protection (e.g., digital signing, encryption), and verification (e.g., signature validation) of identity assertions
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Access permissions, entitlements, and authorizations are defined in a policy, managed, enforced, and reviewed, and incorporate the principles of least privilege and separation of duties
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Review logical and physical access privileges periodically and whenever someone changes roles or leaves the organization, and promptly rescind privileges that are no longer needed
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Take attributes of the requester and the requested resource into account for authorization decisions (e.g., geolocation, day/time, requester endpoint's cyber health)
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Restrict access and privileges to the minimum necessary (e.g., zero trust architecture)
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Periodically review the privileges associated with critical business functions to confirm proper separation of duties
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Physical access to assets is managed, monitored, and enforced commensurate with risk
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Use security guards, security cameras, locked entrances, alarm systems, and other physical controls to monitor facilities and restrict access
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Employ additional physical security controls for areas that contain high-risk assets
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Escort guests, vendors, and other third parties within areas that contain business-critical assets
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: The organization's personnel are provided with cybersecurity awareness and training so that they can perform their cybersecurity-related tasks
elements.title: Awareness and Training

elements.text: Personnel are provided with awareness and training so that they possess the knowledge and skills to perform general tasks with cybersecurity risks in mind
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Provide basic cybersecurity awareness and training to employees, contractors, partners, suppliers, and all other users of the organization's non-public resources
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Train personnel to recognize social engineering attempts and other common attacks, report attacks and suspicious activity, comply with acceptable use policies, and perform basic cyber hygiene tasks (e.g., patching software, choosing passwords, protecting credentials)
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Explain the consequences of cybersecurity policy violations, both to individual users and the organization as a whole
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Periodically assess or test users on their understanding of basic cybersecurity practices
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Require annual refreshers to reinforce existing practices and introduce new practices
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: Individuals in specialized roles are provided with awareness and training so that they possess the knowledge and skills to perform relevant tasks with cybersecurity risks in mind
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Identify the specialized roles within the organization that require additional cybersecurity training, such as physical and cybersecurity personnel, finance personnel, senior leadership, and anyone with access to business-critical data
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Provide role-based cybersecurity awareness and training to all those in specialized roles, including contractors, partners, suppliers, and other third parties
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Periodically assess or test users on their understanding of cybersecurity practices for their specialized roles
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Require annual refreshers to reinforce existing practices and introduce new practices
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) understand their roles and responsibilities
Incorporated into PR.AT-01, PR.AT-02
Senior executives understand their roles and responsibilities
Incorporated into PR.AT-02
Physical and cybersecurity personnel understand their roles and responsibilities
Incorporated into PR.AT-02
Data are managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information
elements.title: Data Security

elements.text: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-at-rest are protected
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Use encryption, digital signatures, and cryptographic hashes to protect the confidentiality and integrity of stored data in files, databases, virtual machine disk images, container images, and other resources
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Use full disk encryption to protect data stored on user endpoints
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Confirm the integrity of software by validating signatures
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Restrict the use of removable media to prevent data exfiltration
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Physically secure removable media containing unencrypted sensitive information, such as within locked offices or file cabinets
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-transit are protected
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Use encryption, digital signatures, and cryptographic hashes to protect the confidentiality and integrity of network communications
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Automatically encrypt or block outbound emails and other communications that contain sensitive data, depending on the data classification
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Block access to personal email, file sharing, file storage services, and other personal communications applications and services from organizational systems and networks
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Prevent reuse of sensitive data from production environments (e.g., customer records) in development, testing, and other non-production environments
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Assets are formally managed throughout removal, transfers, and disposition
Incorporated into ID.AM-08, PR.PS-03
Adequate capacity to ensure availability is maintained
Moved to PR.IR-04
Protections against data leaks are implemented
Incorporated into PR.DS-01, PR.DS-02, PR.DS-10
Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify software, firmware, and information integrity
Incorporated into PR.DS-01, DE.CM-09
The development and testing environment(s) are separate from the production environment
Incorporated into PR.IR-01
Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify hardware integrity
Incorporated into ID.RA-09, DE.CM-09
The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-use are protected
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Remove data that must remain confidential (e.g., from processors and memory) as soon as it is no longer needed
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Protect data in use from access by other users and processes of the same platform
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Backups of data are created, protected, maintained, and tested
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Continuously back up critical data in near-real-time, and back up other data frequently at agreed-upon schedules
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Test backups and restores for all types of data sources at least annually
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Securely store some backups offline and offsite so that an incident or disaster will not damage them
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Enforce geographic separation and geolocation restrictions for data backup storage
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: The hardware, software (e.g., firmware, operating systems, applications), and services of physical and virtual platforms are managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect their confidentiality, integrity, and availability
elements.title: Platform Security

elements.text: Configuration management practices are established and applied
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Establish, test, deploy, and maintain hardened baselines that enforce the organization's cybersecurity policies and provide only essential capabilities (i.e., principle of least functionality)
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Review all default configuration settings that may potentially impact cybersecurity when installing or upgrading software
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Monitor implemented software for deviations from approved baselines
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Software is maintained, replaced, and removed commensurate with risk
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Perform routine and emergency patching within the timeframes specified in the vulnerability management plan
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Update container images, and deploy new container instances to replace rather than update existing instances
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Replace end-of-life software and service versions with supported, maintained versions
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Uninstall and remove unauthorized software and services that pose undue risks
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Uninstall and remove any unnecessary software components (e.g., operating system utilities) that attackers might misuse
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: Define and implement plans for software and service end-of-life maintenance support and obsolescence
elements.title: Ex6

elements.text: Hardware is maintained, replaced, and removed commensurate with risk
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Replace hardware when it lacks needed security capabilities or when it cannot support software with needed security capabilities
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Define and implement plans for hardware end-of-life maintenance support and obsolescence
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Perform hardware disposal in a secure, responsible, and auditable manner
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Log records are generated and made available for continuous monitoring
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Configure all operating systems, applications, and services (including cloud-based services) to generate log records
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Configure log generators to securely share their logs with the organization's logging infrastructure systems and services
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Configure log generators to record the data needed by zero-trust architectures
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Installation and execution of unauthorized software are prevented
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: When risk warrants it, restrict software execution to permitted products only or deny the execution of prohibited and unauthorized software
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Verify the source of new software and the software's integrity before installing it
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Configure platforms to use only approved DNS services that block access to known malicious domains
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Configure platforms to allow the installation of organization-approved software only
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Secure software development practices are integrated, and their performance is monitored throughout the software development life cycle
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Protect all components of organization-developed software from tampering and unauthorized access
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Secure all software produced by the organization, with minimal vulnerabilities in their releases
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Maintain the software used in production environments, and securely dispose of software once it is no longer needed
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Security architectures are managed with the organization's risk strategy to protect asset confidentiality, integrity, and availability, and organizational resilience
elements.title: Technology Infrastructure Resilience

elements.text: Networks and environments are protected from unauthorized logical access and usage
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Logically segment organization networks and cloud-based platforms according to trust boundaries and platform types (e.g., IT, IoT, OT, mobile, guests), and permit required communications only between segments
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Logically segment organization networks from external networks, and permit only necessary communications to enter the organization's networks from the external networks
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Implement zero trust architectures to restrict network access to each resource to the minimum necessary
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Check the cyber health of endpoints before allowing them to access and use production resources
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: The organization's technology assets are protected from environmental threats
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Protect organizational equipment from known environmental threats, such as flooding, fire, wind, and excessive heat and humidity
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Include protection from environmental threats and provisions for adequate operating infrastructure in requirements for service providers that operate systems on the organization's behalf
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Mechanisms are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Avoid single points of failure in systems and infrastructure
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Use load balancing to increase capacity and improve reliability
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Use high-availability components like redundant storage and power supplies to improve system reliability
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Adequate resource capacity to ensure availability is maintained
Monitor usage of storage, power, compute, network bandwidth, and other resources
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Forecast future needs, and scale resources accordingly
elements.title: Ex2
Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control

elements.text: Identities and credentials are issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited for authorized devices, users and processes
Incorporated into PR.AA-01, PR.AA-05
Physical access to assets is managed and protected
Moved to PR.AA-06
Remote access is managed
Incorporated into PR.AA-03, PR.AA-05, PR.IR-01
Access permissions and authorizations are managed, incorporating the principles of least privilege and separation of duties
Moved to PR.AA-05
Network integrity is protected (e.g., network segregation, network segmentation)
Incorporated into PR.IR-01
Identities are proofed and bound to credentials and asserted in interactions
Moved to PR.AA-02

Users, devices, and other assets are authenticated (e.g., single-factor, multi-factor) commensurate with the risk of the transaction (e.g., individualsâ€™ security and privacy risks and other organizational risks)
Moved to PR.AA-03
Moved to PR.AA

elements.title: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control

elements.text: A baseline configuration of information technology/industrial control systems is created and maintained incorporating security principles (e.g. concept of least functionality)
Incorporated into PR.PS-01
A System Development Life Cycle to manage systems is implemented
Incorporated into ID.AM-08, PR.PS-06
Configuration change control processes are in place
Incorporated into PR.PS-01, ID.RA-07
Backups of information are conducted, maintained, and tested
Moved to PR.DS-11
Policy and regulations regarding the physical operating environment for organizational assets are met
Moved to PR.IR-02
Data is destroyed according to policy
Incorporated into ID.AM-08
Protection processes are improved
Incorporated into ID.IM, ID.IM-03
Effectiveness of protection technologies is shared
Moved to ID.IM-03
Response plans (Incident Response and Business Continuity) and recovery plans (Incident Recovery and Disaster Recovery) are in place and managed
Moved to ID.IM-04
Response and recovery plans are tested
Incorporated into ID.IM-02, ID.IM-04
Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices (e.g., deprovisioning, personnel screening)
Moved to GV.RR-04
A vulnerability management plan is developed and implemented
Incorporated into ID.RA-01, PR.PS-02
Incorporated into other Categories and Functions
Maintenance and repair of organizational assets are performed and logged, with approved and controlled tools
Incorporated into ID.AM-08, PR.PS-03
Remote maintenance of organizational assets is approved, logged, and performed in a manner that prevents unauthorized access
Incorporated into ID.AM-08, PR.PS-02
Incorporated into ID.AM-08
Audit/log records are determined, documented, implemented, and reviewed in accordance with policy
Incorporated into PR.PS-04
Removable media is protected and its use restricted according to policy
Incorporated into PR.DS-01, PR.PS-01
The principle of least functionality is incorporated by configuring systems to provide only essential capabilities
Incorporated into PR.PS-01
Communications and control networks are protected
Incorporated into PR.AA-06, PR.IR-01
Mechanisms (e.g., failsafe, load balancing, hot swap) are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations
Moved to PR.IR-03
Incorporated into other Protect Categories
Possible cybersecurity attacks and compromises are found and analyzed
elements.title: DETECT

elements.text: Assets are monitored to find anomalies, indicators of compromise, and other potentially adverse events
elements.title: Continuous Monitoring

elements.text: Networks and network services are monitored to find potentially adverse events
Monitor DNS, BGP, and other network services for adverse events
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Monitor wired and wireless networks for connections from unauthorized endpoints
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Monitor facilities for unauthorized or rogue wireless networks
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Compare actual network flows against baselines to detect deviations
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Monitor network communications to identify changes in security postures for zero trust purposes
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: 1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: The physical environment is monitored to find potentially adverse events
Monitor logs from physical access control systems (e.g., badge readers) to find unusual access patterns (e.g., deviations from the norm) and failed access attempts
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Review and monitor physical access records (e.g., from visitor registration, sign-in sheets)
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Monitor physical access controls (e.g., locks, latches, hinge pins, alarms) for signs of tampering
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Monitor the physical environment using alarm systems, cameras, and security guards
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: 1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Personnel activity and technology usage are monitored to find potentially adverse events
Use behavior analytics software to detect anomalous user activity to mitigate insider threats
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Monitor logs from logical access control systems to find unusual access patterns and failed access attempts
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Continuously monitor deception technology, including user accounts, for any usage
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: 1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Malicious code is detected
Incorporated into DE.CM-01, DE.CM-09
Unauthorized mobile code is detected
Incorporated into DE.CM-01, DE.CM-09
External service provider activities and services are monitored to find potentially adverse events
Monitor remote and onsite administration and maintenance activities that external providers perform on organizational systems
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Monitor activity from cloud-based services, internet service providers, and other service providers for deviations from expected behavior
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Monitoring for unauthorized personnel, connections, devices, and software is performed
Incorporated into DE.CM-01, DE.CM-03, DE.CM-06, DE.CM-09
Vulnerability scans are performed
Incorporated into ID.RA-01
Computing hardware and software, runtime environments, and their data are monitored to find potentially adverse events
Monitor email, web, file sharing, collaboration services, and other common attack vectors to detect malware, phishing, data leaks and exfiltration, and other adverse events
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Monitor authentication attempts to identify attacks against credentials and unauthorized credential reuse
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Monitor software configurations for deviations from security baselines
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Monitor hardware and software for signs of tampering
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Use technologies with a presence on endpoints to detect cyber health issues (e.g., missing patches, malware infections, unauthorized software), and redirect the endpoints to a remediation environment before access is authorized
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: 1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Anomalies, indicators of compromise, and other potentially adverse events are analyzed to characterize the events and detect cybersecurity incidents
elements.title: Adverse Event Analysis

elements.text: A baseline of network operations and expected data flows for users and systems is established and managed
Incorporated into ID.AM-03
Potentially adverse events are analyzed to better understand associated activities
Use security information and event management (SIEM) or other tools to continuously monitor log events for known malicious and suspicious activity
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Utilize up-to-date cyber threat intelligence in log analysis tools to improve detection accuracy and characterize threat actors, their methods, and indicators of compromise
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Regularly conduct manual reviews of log events for technologies that cannot be sufficiently monitored through automation
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Use log analysis tools to generate reports on their findings
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: 1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Information is correlated from multiple sources
Constantly transfer log data generated by other sources to a relatively small number of log servers
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Use event correlation technology (e.g., SIEM) to collect information captured by multiple sources
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Utilize cyber threat intelligence to help correlate events among log sources
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: 1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: The estimated impact and scope of adverse events are understood
Use SIEMs or other tools to estimate impact and scope, and review and refine the estimates
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: A person creates their own estimates of impact and scope
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: 1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Incident alert thresholds are established
Moved to DE.AE-08
Information on adverse events is provided to authorized staff and tools
Use cybersecurity software to generate alerts and provide them to the security operations center (SOC), incident responders, and incident response tools
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Incident responders and other authorized personnel can access log analysis findings at all times
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Automatically create and assign tickets in the organization's ticketing system when certain types of alerts occur
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Manually create and assign tickets in the organization's ticketing system when technical staff discover indicators of compromise
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: 1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Cyber threat intelligence and other contextual information are integrated into the analysis
Securely provide cyber threat intelligence feeds to detection technologies, processes, and personnel
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Securely provide information from asset inventories to detection technologies, processes, and personnel
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Rapidly acquire and analyze vulnerability disclosures for the organization's technologies from suppliers, vendors, and third-party security advisories
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: 1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Incidents are declared when adverse events meet the defined incident criteria
Apply incident criteria to known and assumed characteristics of activity in order to determine whether an incident should be declared
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Take known false positives into account when applying incident criteria
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: 1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Roles and responsibilities for detection are well defined to ensure accountability
Incorporated into GV.RR-02
Detection activities comply with all applicable requirements
Incorporated into DE.AE
Detection processes are tested
Incorporated into ID.IM-02
Event detection information is communicated
Incorporated into DE.AE-06
Detection processes are continuously improved
Incorporated into ID.IM, ID.IM-03
Incorporated into other Categories and Functions
Actions regarding a detected cybersecurity incident are taken
elements.title: RESPOND

elements.text: Responses to detected cybersecurity incidents are managed
elements.title: Incident Management

elements.text: The incident response plan is executed in coordination with relevant third parties once an incident is declared
Detection technologies automatically report confirmed incidents
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Request incident response assistance from the organization's incident response outsourcer
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Designate an incident lead for each incident
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Initiate execution of additional cybersecurity plans as needed to support incident response (for example, business continuity and disaster recovery)
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Incident reports are triaged and validated
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Preliminarily review incident reports to confirm that they are cybersecurity-related and necessitate incident response activities
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Apply criteria to estimate the severity of an incident
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Incidents are categorized and prioritized
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Further review and categorize incidents based on the type of incident (e.g., data breach, ransomware, DDoS, account compromise)
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Prioritize incidents based on their scope, likely impact, and time-critical nature
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Select incident response strategies for active incidents by balancing the need to quickly recover from an incident with the need to observe the attacker or conduct a more thorough investigation
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Incidents are escalated or elevated as needed
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Track and validate the status of all ongoing incidents
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Coordinate incident escalation or elevation with designated internal and external stakeholders
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: The criteria for initiating incident recovery are applied
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Apply incident recovery criteria to known and assumed characteristics of the incident to determine whether incident recovery processes should be initiated
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Take the possible operational disruption of incident recovery activities into account
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Investigations are conducted to ensure effective response and support forensics and recovery activities
elements.title: Incident Analysis

elements.text: Notifications from detection systems are investigated
Incorporated into RS.MA-02
The impact of the incident is understood
Incorporated into RS.MA-02, RS.MA-03, RS.MA-04
Analysis is performed to establish what has taken place during an incident and the root cause of the incident
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Determine the sequence of events that occurred during the incident and which assets and resources were involved in each event
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Attempt to determine what vulnerabilities, threats, and threat actors were directly or indirectly involved in the incident
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Analyze the incident to find the underlying, systemic root causes
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Check any cyber deception technology for additional information on attacker behavior
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Incidents are categorized consistent with response plans
Moved to RS.MA-03

Processes are established to receive, analyze and respond to vulnerabilities disclosed to the organization from internal and external sources (e.g. internal testing, security bulletins, or security researchers)
Moved to ID.RA-08
Actions performed during an investigation are recorded, and the records' integrity and provenance are preserved
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Require each incident responder and others (e.g., system administrators, cybersecurity engineers) who perform incident response tasks to record their actions and make the record immutable
elements.title: Ex1
