elements.text: Require the incident lead to document the incident in detail and be responsible for preserving the integrity of the documentation and the sources of all information being reported
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Incident data and metadata are collected, and their integrity and provenance are preserved
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Collect, preserve, and safeguard the integrity of all pertinent incident data and metadata (e.g., data source, date/time of collection) based on evidence preservation and chain-of-custody procedures
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: An incident's magnitude is estimated and validated
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Review other potential targets of the incident to search for indicators of compromise and evidence of persistence
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Automatically run tools on targets to look for indicators of compromise and evidence of persistence
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders as required by laws, regulations, or policies
elements.title: Incident Response Reporting and Communication

elements.text: Personnel know their roles and order of operations when a response is needed
Incorporated into PR.AT-01
Internal and external stakeholders are notified of incidents
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Follow the organization's breach notification procedures after discovering a data breach incident, including notifying affected customers
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Notify business partners and customers of incidents in accordance with contractual requirements
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Notify law enforcement agencies and regulatory bodies of incidents based on criteria in the incident response plan and management approval
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Information is shared with designated internal and external stakeholders
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Securely share information consistent with response plans and information sharing agreements
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Voluntarily share information about an attacker's observed TTPs, with all sensitive data removed, with an Information Sharing and Analysis Center (ISAC)
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Notify HR when malicious insider activity occurs
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Regularly update senior leadership on the status of major incidents
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Follow the rules and protocols defined in contracts for incident information sharing between the organization and its suppliers
elements.title: Ex5

elements.text: Coordinate crisis communication methods between the organization and its critical suppliers
elements.title: Ex6

elements.text: Coordination with stakeholders occurs consistent with response plans
Incorporated into RS.MA-01, RS.MA-04
Voluntary information sharing occurs with external stakeholders to achieve broader cybersecurity situational awareness
Incorporated into RS.CO-03
Activities are performed to prevent expansion of an event and mitigate its effects
elements.title: Incident Mitigation

elements.text: Incidents are contained
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Cybersecurity technologies (e.g., antivirus software) and cybersecurity features of other technologies (e.g., operating systems, network infrastructure devices) automatically perform containment actions
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Allow incident responders to manually select and perform containment actions
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Allow a third party (e.g., internet service provider, managed security service provider) to perform containment actions on behalf of the organization
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Automatically transfer compromised endpoints to a remediation virtual local area network (VLAN)
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Incidents are eradicated
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Cybersecurity technologies and cybersecurity features of other technologies (e.g., operating systems, network infrastructure devices) automatically perform eradication actions
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Allow incident responders to manually select and perform eradication actions
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Allow a third party (e.g., managed security service provider) to perform eradication actions on behalf of the organization
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Newly identified vulnerabilities are mitigated or documented as accepted risks
Incorporated into ID.RA-06
Response plan is executed during or after an incident
Incorporated into RS.MA-01
Incorporated into RS.MA
Response plans incorporate lessons learned
Incorporated into ID.IM-03, ID.IM-04
Response strategies are updated
Incorporated into ID.IM-03
Incorporated into ID.IM
Assets and operations affected by a cybersecurity incident are restored
elements.title: RECOVER

elements.text: Restoration activities are performed to ensure operational availability of systems and services affected by cybersecurity incidents
elements.title: Incident Recovery Plan Execution

elements.text: The recovery portion of the incident response plan is executed once initiated from the incident response process
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Begin recovery procedures during or after incident response processes
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Make all individuals with recovery responsibilities aware of the plans for recovery and the authorizations required to implement each aspect of the plans
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Recovery actions are selected, scoped, prioritized, and performed
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Select recovery actions based on the criteria defined in the incident response plan and available resources
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Change planned recovery actions based on a reassessment of organizational needs and resources
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: The integrity of backups and other restoration assets is verified before using them for restoration
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Check restoration assets for indicators of compromise, file corruption, and other integrity issues before use
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Critical mission functions and cybersecurity risk management are considered to establish post-incident operational norms
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Use business impact and system categorization records (including service delivery objectives) to validate that essential services are restored in the appropriate order
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Work with system owners to confirm the successful restoration of systems and the return to normal operations
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Monitor the performance of restored systems to verify the adequacy of the restoration
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: The integrity of restored assets is verified, systems and services are restored, and normal operating status is confirmed
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Check restored assets for indicators of compromise and remediation of root causes of the incident before production use
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Verify the correctness and adequacy of the restoration actions taken before putting a restored system online
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: The end of incident recovery is declared based on criteria, and incident-related documentation is completed
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Prepare an after-action report that documents the incident itself, the response and recovery actions taken, and lessons learned
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Declare the end of incident recovery once the criteria are met
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Restoration activities are coordinated with internal and external parties
elements.title: Incident Recovery Communication

elements.text: Public relations are managed
Incorporated into RC.CO-04
Reputation is repaired after an incident
Incorporated into RC.CO-04
Recovery activities and progress in restoring operational capabilities are communicated to designated internal and external stakeholders
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: 3rd Party Risk
elements.title: 3rd

elements.text: Securely share recovery information, including restoration progress, consistent with response plans and information sharing agreements
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Regularly update senior leadership on recovery status and restoration progress for major incidents
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Follow the rules and protocols defined in contracts for incident information sharing between the organization and its suppliers
elements.title: Ex3

elements.text: Coordinate crisis communication between the organization and its critical suppliers
elements.title: Ex4

elements.text: Public updates on incident recovery are shared using approved methods and messaging
1st Party Risk
elements.title: 1st

elements.text: Follow the organization's breach notification procedures for recovering from a data breach incident
elements.title: Ex1

elements.text: Explain the steps being taken to recover from the incident and to prevent a recurrence
elements.title: Ex2

elements.text: Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned
Incorporated into ID.IM-03, ID.IM-04
Recovery strategies are updated

Incorporated into ID.IM
